en: [Letter], 1857 Nov. 18, Executive Department, Tahlequah [to] Colo[nel] George Butler, U[nited] S[tates] Agent / John Ross

(Copy ?) of a letter dated November 18, 1857 from John Ross, Principal Chief of the Cherokee Nation, to Colonel George Butler calling on Butler to remove intruders from the "Neutral Land" per an act of the National Council. A copy of the act, originally enclosed, is no longer attached. A note on the back indicates that this letter is a copy, but Ross's signature appears to be in his own hand.

none: [Letter], 1857 Nov. 18, Executive Department, Tahlequah [to] Colo[nel] George Butler, U[nited] S[tates] Agent / John Ross : page 1

body.value: Executive Department Tahlequah Nov. 18th. 1857 Colo. Colonel George Butler U.S. Agent Sir,, In compliance with the requirements of the enclosed Copy of an Act of the National Council; It has you will perceive that it has become my duty again, "to call upon you, as, the Agent of the United States , for the immediate removal of the intruders upon the Neutral Lands" I am Sir, Very respectfully Your Obt. Servt. Obedient Servant John Ross Prinl. Principal Chief Cherokee Nation

none: [Letter], 1857 Nov. 18, Executive Department, Tahlequah [to] Colo[nel] George Butler, U[nited] S[tates] Agent / John Ross : page 2

body.value: Copy of a Note to Colo. Geo. Colonel George Butler U.S. Agent respecting the intruders upon the Neutral Land 18th Nov.
